intro: Hieracium bracteolicaule, commonly known as the bracteolate hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
